comment.author: 46566419@N08
comment._content: Seems to have been built by Caird & Co. of Greenock, "Arabia" was launched in 1897. www.clydesite.co.uk/clydebuilt/viewship.asp?id=15029 www.greatships.net/arabia.html

comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Arabia RMS Arabia was a P&O passenger liner torpedoed on 6 November 1916 by the German submarine UB-43. She was built 1898 at Caird & Co in Greenock to carry 480 passengers and served mostly on the Australian trade. There are very few records of the vessel, but a sister ship, (the Egypt) is described as length 500ft x beam 54.4ft, two funnels, single screw, speed 16 knots.....
